definition: to braise/to cook in soy and vinegar/braised/cooked in soy and vinegar

sentences.english: Clam chowders have --- as the name suggests --- clams and fish stock.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊海鲜杂烩里面还有蛤蜊和鱼类高汤。

sentences.english: like a melange of all different sort of things.
sentences.chinese: 像一个汇集了各种事物的大杂烩。

sentences.english: The first of countless bowls of chowder.
sentences.chinese: 第一次吃了这么多碗的杂烩。

sentences.english: Poutine is a messy, rich version of gravy fries in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大，普丁是杂烩型，加料版本的肉汁薯条。

sentences.english: We produce the finest Ratatouille in all of France.
sentences.chinese: 我们做出全法国最鲜美的蔬菜杂烩。

sentences.english: The metropolis is a confusion of old and new.
sentences.chinese: 大都市是新与旧的大杂烩。

sentences.english: Best paired with New England style corn-and-cod chowder or Portobello and polenta tamales.
sentences.chinese: 配搭新英格兰式的玉米鳕鱼杂烩或麦片玉米粽子。

sentences.english: The original concoction Mandigo made was formed as a faux pork chop.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，曼迪哥最早研制出的是一种仿猪排杂烩。

sentences.english: Japanese is turning into a confused mishmash of languages.
sentences.chinese: 日语正变成一个混乱的大杂烩。

sentences.english: Soon I was singing about Mrs. Murphy's chowder.
sentences.chinese: 不久我开始唱起《墨菲太太的杂烩汤》。

sentences.english: But this kind of exhibition is easyly to be made into hodgepodge .
sentences.chinese: 但是这种展览也容易做成大杂烩。

sentences.english: Just make sure that you are not simply ordering chopsuey takeout.
sentences.chinese: 还是快别再叫什么外卖大杂烩了吧。

sentences.english: Probably with mixture of political upheaval and diplomatic intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 很有可能是个政治动荡和外交纷争的杂烩。

definition: to braise/to cook in soy and vinegar/braised/cooked in soy and vinegar
the Manchu Han imperial feast, a legendary banquet in the Qing dynasty/(fig.) a sumptuous banquet
dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
